title: Website Downtime Alert via LINE + Supabase Log
author: sayamol thiramonpaphakul
readme:
This workflow automatically checks the status of your websites using UptimeRobot API. If any site is down or unstable, it will:

  * Generate a natural-language alert message using GPT-4o
  * Push the message to a LINE group (with funny IT-style encouragement)
  * Log all DOWN status entries into your Supabase database
  * Wait 30 minutes before repeating



üîß How It Works

  1. Schedule Trigger ‚Äì Runs on a fixed interval (every few minutes).
  2. UptimeRobot Node ‚Äì Fetches website monitor data.
  3. Code Node (Filter) ‚Äì Filters only websites with status 8 (may be down) or 9 (down).
  4. IF Node ‚Äì If any site is down, proceed.
  5. LangChain LLM Node ‚Äì Formats alert with a humorous message using GPT-4o.
  6. Line Notify (HTTP Request) ‚Äì Sends the alert to your LINE group.
  7. Loop Over Items ‚Äì Loops through all monitors.
  8. Filter Down (Status = 9) ‚Äì Selects only ‚Äúfully down‚Äù sites.
  9. Supabase Node ‚Äì Logs these into synlora_uptime_down table.
  10. Wait Node ‚Äì Delays next alert by 30 minutes to avoid spamming.



‚öôÔ∏è Setup Steps

Required:

  * üîó UptimeRobot API Key
  * üì≤ LINE Channel Access Token and Group ID
  * üß† OpenAI Key (GPT-4o Mini)
  * üóÉÔ∏è Supabase Project & Table



Step-by-step:

  1. Go to UptimeRobot ‚Üí Get API key and ensure monitors are set up.
  2. Create a Supabase table with fields: website, status, uptime_id.
  3. Create a LINE Messaging API bot, join it to your group, and get: 
     1. Access Token
     2. Group ID (userId or groupId)
  4. Add your OpenAI API Key for GPT-4o Mini (or switch to your preferred LLM).
  5. Import the workflow JSON into n8n.
  6. Set credentials in all necessary nodes.
  7. Activate the workflow.
